entry.title: Gyarah Murti (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Gyarah Murti statue was featured on the Indian 500-rupee note (pictured)?

entry.title: Bernard Toone (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Bernard Toone received a standing ovation after being berated by coach Al McGuire to the point of tears?

entry.title: Jump!! The Heroes Behind the Gold (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that as women's ski jumping was not then an Olympic event, Yoshiko Kasai participated as the only female test jumper at the 1998 Winter Olympics, as dramatized in Jump!! The Heroes Behind the Gold?

entry.title: Education for Economic Security Act (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Education for Economic Security Act prohibited secular humanism in magnet schools?

entry.title: Katja Husen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Katja Husen was the speaker of the Green Youth, a member of the Hamburg Parliament, and the CEO of the Centre for Molecular Neurobiology Hamburg?

entry.title: a film that critiques body shaming (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that singer Billie Eilish wrote and produced a film that critiques body shaming?

entry.title: Kamome Shirahama (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Kamome Shirahama, in addition to writing and illustrating her best-selling Witch Hat Atelier manga series, has created variant covers for DC Comics, Marvel Comics, and the Star Wars franchise?

entry.title: flag of Barbados (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the man who designed the flag of Barbados also made the first few flags himself out of fabric from a department store?
